medical_history.chief_complaint: Fever, confusion, liver failure, anemia, and thrombocytopenia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been in her usual state of health until 2 to 3 weeks before admission when low-grade fevers developed and relatives noted she was acting strangely with slurred speech and urinary incontinence. About 3 days before admission, increasing confusion and diarrhea developed.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hepatitis C virus infection and cirrhosis. Previous head injury and neurosurgery for intracranial hemorrhage 2 years prior.
medical_history.family_history: Mother died at 88 of unspecified blood disorder and stomach cancer; father died at 51 from emphysema. Son is healthy.
medical_history.social_history: History of intravenous drug abuse 30 years earlier, cocaine use, and alcohol abuse until 9 years prior. Lives with boyfriend and many pets, including strays.
